title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Mücke M (2024). worldbank: Client World Banks's 'Indicators' 'Poverty Inequality Platform (PIP)' APIs. R package version 0.2.0.9000, https://github.com/m-muecke/worldbank, https://m-muecke.github.io/worldbank/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {worldbank: Client for World Banks's 'Indicators' and 'Poverty and Inequality Platform (PIP)' APIs},   author = {Maximilian Mücke},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.2.0.9000,     https://github.com/m-muecke/worldbank},   url = {https://m-muecke.github.io/worldbank/}, }

title: Client for World Bankss Indicators and Poverty and Inequality Platform (PIP)' APIs
text: worlbank provides simple interface World Bank Indicators API v2 World Bank Poverty Inequality Platform (PIP) API. main difference packages ’s modern implementation using httr2 package supports available endpoints parameters. worldbank package provides set functions interact various endpoints World Bank Indicators API. function designed retrieve specific types data, making easier access analyze World Bank datasets. overview available endpoints corresponding functions package: Languages (wb_language): Retrieves list languages supported World Bank API. Useful obtaining language-specific data. Lending Types (wb_lending_type): Fetches information different lending types recognized World Bank. Income Levels (wb_income_level): Allows users access data various income levels defined World Bank. Sources (wb_source): Provides details different data sources available within World Bank’s datasets. Topics (wb_topic): Lists topics covered World Bank API, helping users narrow data search specific areas interest. Regions (wb_region): Offers information different geographical regions categorized World Bank. Countries (wb_country): Enables access detailed data individual countries, including socio-economic developmental indicators. Country Indicators (wb_country_indicator): Specific retrieving indicators particular country countries, allowing targeted data analysis. Indicators (wb_indicator): endpoint gives users access wide array indicators used World Bank data analysis reports.

title: Client for World Bankss Indicators and Poverty and Inequality Platform (PIP)' APIs
text: can install released version worldbank CRAN : development version GitHub :
code: install.packages("worldbank") # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("m-muecke/worldbank")

title: Client for World Bankss Indicators and Poverty and Inequality Platform (PIP)' APIs
text: worldbank functions prefixed wb_ follow naming convention World Bank API v2.
code: library(worldbank)  # filter by specific country wb_country(c("US", "DE")) #> # A tibble: 2 × 18 #>   country_id country_code country_name  region_id region_code region_value       #>   <chr>      <chr>        <chr>         <chr>     <chr>       <chr>              #> 1 DEU        DE           Germany       ECS       Z7          Europe & Central … #> 2 USA        US           United States NAC       XU          North America      #> # ℹ 12 more variables: admin_region_id <chr>, admin_region_code <chr>, #> #   admin_region_value <chr>, income_level_id <chr>, income_level_code <chr>, #> #   income_level_value <chr>, lending_type_id <chr>, lending_type_code <chr>, #> #   lending_type_value <chr>, capital_city <chr>, longitude <dbl>, #> #   latitude <dbl>  # or fetch all (default) wb_country() #> # A tibble: 296 × 18 #>   country_id country_code country_name        region_id region_code region_value #>   <chr>      <chr>        <chr>               <chr>     <chr>       <chr>        #> 1 ABW        AW           Aruba               LCN       ZJ          Latin Ameri… #> 2 AFE        ZH           Africa Eastern and… NA        NA          Aggregates   #> 3 AFG        AF           Afghanistan         SAS       8S          South Asia   #> 4 AFR        A9           Africa              NA        NA          Aggregates   #> 5 AFW        ZI           Africa Western and… NA        NA          Aggregates   #> # ℹ 291 more rows #> # ℹ 12 more variables: admin_region_id <chr>, admin_region_code <chr>, #> #   admin_region_value <chr>, income_level_id <chr>, income_level_code <chr>, #> #   income_level_value <chr>, lending_type_id <chr>, lending_type_code <chr>, #> #   lending_type_value <chr>, capital_city <chr>, longitude <dbl>, #> #   latitude <dbl>  # search for specific indicator ind <- wb_indicator() ind <- subset(   ind,   grepl("GDP", id, fixed = TRUE) & source_value == "World Development Indicators" ) ind #> # A tibble: 35 × 9 #>   id          name  unit  source_id source_value source_note source_organization #>   <chr>       <chr> <chr> <chr>     <chr>        <chr>       <chr>               #> 1 EG.GDP.PUS… GDP … <NA>  2         World Devel… GDP per un… IEA Statistics © O… #> 2 EG.GDP.PUS… GDP … <NA>  2         World Devel… GDP per un… IEA Statistics © O… #> 3 ER.GDP.FWT… Wate… <NA>  2         World Devel… Water prod… Food and Agricultu… #> 4 NY.GDP.COA… Coal… <NA>  2         World Devel… Coal rents… World Bank staff e… #> 5 NY.GDP.DEF… Infl… <NA>  2         World Devel… Inflation … World Bank nationa… #> # ℹ 30 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: topic_id <chr>, topic_value <chr>  # fetch indicator data for specific or all countries (default) gdp <- wb_country_indicator("NY.GDP.MKTP.CD", c("US", "DE", "FR", "CH", "JP")) gdp #> # A tibble: 320 × 10 #>    date indicator_id indicator_name country_id country_name country_code   value #>   <int> <chr>        <chr>          <chr>      <chr>        <chr>          <dbl> #> 1  2023 NY.GDP.MKTP… GDP (current … CH         Switzerland  CHE          8.85e11 #> 2  2022 NY.GDP.MKTP… GDP (current … CH         Switzerland  CHE          8.18e11 #> 3  2021 NY.GDP.MKTP… GDP (current … CH         Switzerland  CHE          8.13e11 #> 4  2020 NY.GDP.MKTP… GDP (current … CH         Switzerland  CHE          7.42e11 #> 5  2019 NY.GDP.MKTP… GDP (current … CH         Switzerland  CHE          7.21e11 #> # ℹ 315 more rows #> # ℹ 3 more variables: unit <chr>, obs_status <chr>, decimal <int>

get countries pip_aux("countries") #> # A tibble: 169 × 8 #>    country_code country_name   africa_split africa_split_code region region_code #>    <chr>        <chr>          <chr>        <chr>             <chr>  <chr>       #>  1 AGO          Angola         Eastern and… AFE               Sub-S… SSA         #>  2 ALB          Albania        NA           NA                Europ… ECA         #>  3 ARE          United Arab E… NA           NA                Other… OHI         #>  4 ARG          Argentina      NA           NA                Latin… LAC         #>  5 ARM          Armenia        NA           NA                Europ… ECA         #>  6 AUS          Australia      NA           NA                Other… OHI         #>  7 AUT          Austria        NA           NA                Other… OHI         #>  8 AZE          Azerbaijan     NA           NA                Europ… ECA         #>  9 BDI          Burundi        Eastern and… AFE               Sub-S… SSA         #> 10 BEL          Belgium        NA           NA                Other… OHI         #> # ℹ 159 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: world <chr>, world_code <chr>  # get GDP pip_aux("gdp") #> # A tibble: 10,340 × 4 #>    country_code data_level  year  value #>    <chr>        <chr>      <int>  <dbl> #>  1 ABW          national    1977    NA  #>  2 ABW          national    1978    NA  #>  3 ABW          national    1979    NA  #>  4 ABW          national    1980    NA  #>  5 ABW          national    1981    NA  #>  6 ABW          national    1982    NA  #>  7 ABW          national    1983    NA  #>  8 ABW          national    1984    NA  #>  9 ABW          national    1985    NA  #> 10 ABW          national    1986 16112. #> # ℹ 10,330 more rows  # get CPI pip_aux("cpi") #> # A tibble: 8,037 × 4 #>    country_code data_level  year value #>    <chr>        <chr>      <int> <dbl> #>  1 AGO          national    1977    NA #>  2 AGO          national    1978    NA #>  3 AGO          national    1979    NA #>  4 AGO          national    1980    NA #>  5 AGO          national    1981    NA #>  6 AGO          national    1982    NA #>  7 AGO          national    1983    NA #>  8 AGO          national    1984    NA #>  9 AGO          national    1985    NA #> 10 AGO          national    1986    NA #> # what: Return main poverty and inequality statistics — pip_data
title: Return main poverty and inequality statistics — pip_data
text: Return main poverty inequality statistics

title: Return main poverty and inequality statistics — pip_data
code: pip_data(   country = NULL,   year = NULL,   povline = 2.15,   popshare = NULL,   fill_gaps = FALSE,   welfare_type = c("all", "consumption", "income"),   reporting_level = c("all", "national", "rural", "urban"),   additional_ind = FALSE,   release_version = NULL,   ppp_version = NULL,   version = NULL )

title: Return main poverty and inequality statistics — pip_data
text: https://pip.worldbank.org/api

title: Return main poverty and inequality statistics — pip_data
text: country character() countries statistics computed, specified ISO3 codes. Default NULL. year character() | numeric() year(s) statistics computed, specified YYYY. Default NULL. povline numeric(1) poverty line used compute poverty mesures. Poverty lines accepted 3 decimals. Default 2.15. popshare numeric(1) proportion population living poverty line. ignored povline specified. Default NULL. fill_gaps logical(1) whether fill gaps data. Default FALSE. welfare_type character(1) type welfare measure used. Default . reporting_level character(1) level reporting statistics. Default . additional_ind logical(1) whether include additional indicators. Default FALSE. release_version character(1) version data release YYYYMMDD format. Default NULL. ppp_version character(1) | numeric(1) version data. Default NULL. version character(1) version data. Default NULL.

title: Return main poverty and inequality statistics — pip_data
text: data.frame() requested statistics.

title: Return main poverty and inequality statistics — pip_data

ℹ 37 more variables: reporting_level <chr>, survey_acronym <chr>, #> #   survey_coverage <chr>, survey_year <dbl>, welfare_type <chr>, #> #   survey_comparability <int>, comparable_spell <chr>, poverty_line <dbl>, #> #   headcount <dbl>, poverty_gap <dbl>, poverty_severity <dbl>, watts <dbl>, #> #   mean <dbl>, median <dbl>, mld <dbl>, gini <dbl>, polarization <dbl>, #> #   decile1 <dbl>, decile2 <dbl>, decile3 <dbl>, decile4 <dbl>, decile5 <dbl>, #> # title: Return aggregation of PIP statistics — pip_group
text: Return aggregation PIP statistics

title: Return aggregation of PIP statistics — pip_group
code: pip_group(   country = NULL,   year = NULL,   povline = 2.15,   popshare = NULL,   group_by = c("wb", "none"),   fill_gaps = FALSE,   welfare_type = c("all", "consumption", "income"),   reporting_level = c("all", "national", "rural", "urban"),   additional_ind = FALSE,   release_version = NULL,   ppp_version = NULL,   version = NULL )

title: Return aggregation of PIP statistics — pip_group
text: https://pip.worldbank.org/api

title: Return aggregation of PIP statistics — pip_group
text: country character() countries statistics computed, specified ISO3 codes. Default NULL. year character() | numeric() year(s) statistics computed, specified YYYY. Default NULL. povline numeric(1) poverty line used compute poverty mesures. Poverty lines accepted 3 decimals. Default 2.15. popshare numeric(1) proportion population living poverty line. ignored povline specified. Default NULL. group_by character(1) aggregate results pre-defined sub-groups. Default "wb". fill_gaps logical(1) whether fill gaps data. Default FALSE. welfare_type character(1) type welfare measure used. Default . reporting_level character(1) level reporting statistics. Default . additional_ind logical(1) whether include additional indicators. Default FALSE. release_version character(1) version data release YYYYMMDD format. Default NULL. ppp_version character(1) | numeric(1) version data. Default NULL. version character(1) version data. Default NULL.

title: Return aggregation of PIP statistics — pip_group
text: data.frame() requested statistics.

what: World Bank country indicator data — wb_country_indicator
title: World Bank country indicator data — wb_country_indicator
text: List country indicators supported World Bank API.

title: World Bank country indicator data — wb_country_indicator
code: wb_country_indicator(   indicator = "NY.GDP.MKTP.CD",   country = NULL,   lang = "en",   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL )

title: World Bank country indicator data — wb_country_indicator
text: http://api.worldbank.org/v2/country/{country}/indicator/{indicator}

title: World Bank country indicator data — wb_country_indicator
text: indicator character(1) indicator query. country character() country query. Default NULL. NULL, countries returned. lang character(1) language query. Default "en". start_date character(1) integer(1) start date query. Default NULL. Supported formats: YYYY yearly data (e.g. 2020 "2020") YYYYQ[1-4] quarterly data (e.g. "2020Q1") YYYYM[1-12] monthly data (e.g. "2020M02") end_date character(1) integer(1) end date query, format start_date. Default NULL.

title: World Bank country indicator data — wb_country_indicator
text: data.frame() available country indicators. columns : date date indicator_id indicator ID. indicator_name indicator name. country_id country ID. country_name country name. country_code country code. value indicator value. unit indicator unit. obs_status observation status. decimal decimal.

title: World Bank country indicator data — wb_country_indicator

ℹ 54 more rows #> # ℹ 4 more variables: value <dbl>, unit <chr>, obs_status <chr>, decimal <int> wb_country_indicator(   "DPANUSSPB", c("CHN", "BRA"),   start_date = "2012M01", end_date = "2012M08" ) #> # A tibble: 16 × 10 #>    date   indicator_id indicator_name country_id country_name country_code value #>    <chr>  <chr>        <chr>          <chr>      <chr>        <chr>        <dbl> #>  1 2012M… DPANUSSPB    Exchange rate… BRA        Brazil       NA            2.03 #>  2 2012M… DPANUSSPB    Exchange rate… BRA        Brazil       NA            2.03 #>  3 2012M… DPANUSSPB    Exchange rate… BRA        Brazil       NA            2.05 #>  4 2012M… DPANUSSPB    Exchange rate… BRA        Brazil       NA            1.98 #>  5 2012M… DPANUSSPB    Exchange rate… BRA        Brazil       NA            1.85 #>  6 2012M… DPANUSSPB    Exchange rate… BRA        Brazil       NA            1.79 #>  7 2012M… DPANUSSPB    Exchange rate… BRA        Brazil       NA            1.72 #>  8 2012M… DPANUSSPB    Exchange rate… BRA        Brazil       NA            1.79 #>  9 2012M… DPANUSSPB    Exchange rate… CHN        China        NA            6.36 #> 10 2012M… DPANUSSPB    Exchange rate… CHN        China        NA            6.37 #> 11 2012M… DPANUSSPB    Exchange rate… CHN        China        NA            6.36 #> 12 2012M… DPANUSSPB    Exchange rate… CHN        China        NA            6.32 #> 13 2012M… DPANUSSPB    Exchange rate… CHN        China        NA            6.30 #> 14 2012M… DPANUSSPB    Exchange rate… CHN        China        NA            6.31 #> 15 2012M… DPANUSSPB    Exchange rate… CHN        China        NA            6.30 #> 16 2012M… DPANUSSPB    Exchange rate… CHN        China        NA            6.31 #> # what: worldbank: Client for World Banks's 'Indicators' and 'Poverty and Inequality Platform (PIP)' APIs — worldbank-package
title: worldbank: Client for World Banks's 'Indicators' and 'Poverty and Inequality Platform (PIP)' APIs — worldbank-package
text: Download search data 'World Bank Indicators API', provides access nearly 16,000 time series indicators. See https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/889392---indicators-api-documentation details API.

title: worldbank: Client for World Banks's 'Indicators' and 'Poverty and Inequality Platform (PIP)' APIs — worldbank-package
text: Maintainer: Maximilian Mücke muecke.maximilian@gmail.com (ORCID)
